Topic.Title: Lenovo dumped tegra and Win RT in their yoga tablet. Samsung dumped

Message.Msg: electronistaDOTcom/articles/13/01/07/docking.convertible.lenovo.notebooks.impressive/ 'The Yoga 11S, on the other hand, immediately caught our eye. It's lightweight, but sturdy, with an aluminum frame that feels like anything but. Our attendant said that the smaller Yoga has a "rubberized paint" finish, giving the unit a grippiness that's striking at first. It's a good feel, if still a little weird. Inside, the Yoga 11S will have a Y-Series Intel Ivy Bridge processor, up to an i7. Lenovo estimates its battery is good for six to seven hours of use. The Yoga 11S will be shipping in May of this year, starting at $799 for the i3 processor model.'

Message.Title: Project Shield Price-My Guess $299
Message.Msg: BOM cost of an Apple IPOD Touch 32GB including manufacture is approx $150. Note: The IPOD Touch has a camera but weaker battery than the Shield. Add in a little for the game pad and distributors cut for selling on Gamer hardware websites or Google Play (free) and Nvidia should easily make $100 to $125 per device sold. I think that is a fair price and profit along with the immense publicity Nvidia has and will have for their Tegra 4 chip, GPUs and Nvidia Grid. It's a Gamer add on for sure and their are 35 million of them world wide.According to Jon Peddie 31% of all GPUs are Performance or Enthusiast Class. Nvidia sells between 3M to 4M of these high performance GPUs to gamers each quarter which is 12M to 16M high performance GPUs per year. It is not unimaginable that 10-15% will buy The Shield 1.2M to 2.4M in yearly sales for the Shield is reasonable. Nice revenue and profit pop from a hobby and marketing vehicle. Note: When you go to the GameStop website you will see that all the Tegra tablets are bundled with some low cost games from TegraZone for a sale event. As someone has already said the bundling with High End Nvidia GPUs having coupons for X off The Shield is going to happen for sure. JMHO

Topic.Title: Attention maravian/getanid - dell xps not yet shipping

Message.Msg: 'It's just starting... ARM64 hasn't even hit the street...' That won't make a difference unless the ARMs have some value proposition to offer over the already 64-bit Atoms to overcome the huge lack of legacy software for WinRT which allows Atom to exclusively double up as fully functional PCs. It's an uphill battle for WinRT. It only made sense originally if Atom had not got down to ARM levels of power with Clovertrail which might then have forced a lot more PC software vendors to port their software to ARM.

Topic.Title: Project Shield Price-My Guess $299

Message.Msg: It's a Gamer add-on and a marketing vehicle for Tegra and Nvidia High End Gpus. And a great marketing vehicle at that...Look at all the publicity and makes some money too. Besides you know Google loves it for sure. Plus the software developers can map their games to controllers in a day. Not sure but I bet the Shield has a mapping function built in. Archos Gameboy does! But my expectation is just like Nvidia said. It's a Gamer add-on. Like those goofy looking 3D glasses that have sold over a million at a ridculusly high gross margin. I will admit that after I saw Gamestop bundling 6 Tegrazone games optimized for Tegra tablets I suspect we know which retail outlet will carry the Shield. They might evensell a little to non-gamers.

Topic.Title: Project Shield Price-My Guess $299

Message.Msg: venturebeatDOTcom/2013/01/09/nvidia-ceos-seven-year-journey-to-make-project-shield-portable-gaming-device-exclusive-interview GamesBeat: How much of the hard work focuses not just on this but also in the whole ecosystem around it? Like, for a console maker, they have to go round up all the game publishers and game developers to get behind a console some months or years ahead of time. Huang: We are perpetually doing that. You know that we work with game developers all over the world to enhance for GeForce or to optimize for Tegra. All of the optimizations that we made for Tegra are in Tegra Zone, and all of those games just showed up. For the last two years, all of the games that we’ve optimized for Tegra have already included controller support. We’ve been preparing for this day. All of those games, the 100 games or so, and the few hundred games in development right now, they’re all being optimized for this.

Message.Title: Tegra 4 is clocked around 2GHz
Message.Msg: We still don’t know the exact clock, as Nvidia is disclosing all the details on Tegra 4, but our sources are telling us that this A15 quad-core with a companion core should reach 2GHz. We have confirmed that Nvidia has already sent out samples of the current revision of the chip and that the final version is on the way. Nvidia will probably have to wait for full blown production in order to set the final frequency. Nvidia partners are currently working on phones and tablets based on the chip, and Nvidia itself said that its Project Shield mini console is to be expected in Q2 2013. Tegra 4 ends up significantly faster than Tegra 3 and the new A15 28nm core should ensure lower power consumption as well. The competition, namely Qualcomm and Samsung are throwing their A15 solutions in the fight for the performance crown and the high-end ARM market will be very crowded in 2013. We are not sure why Nvidia didn’t talk about the fact that Tegra 4 comes with USB 3.0 support which we see as significant, as we did see it on leaked spec sheets late last year.

Topic.Title: Vegas was Expensive, boys. NVDA leaves town (-$581 million) Poorer.

Message.Msg: "Yes boys, a fish bowl on the card table for folks to put their business cards in. For the drawing to win a toy Shield. If giving away nonexistant products as prizes isn't illegal in Spain. Somebody call Legal on that, okay? That's it. Folding card table, cute Spanish girl, fish bowl to win a free toy Shield." Not so good news from Legal, Best. Legal says it lacks "mutuality" -- "la reciprocidad" is the Spanish legal word -- to require the winner to be present to win, if the contest prize isn't, -- and in fact, the contest prize might never be present. So the drawing for a vaporware toy Shield is out, boys. There's good news though. Legal suggests that nvidia go with the same fish bowl contest prize that everybody else at trade shows use. The Genuine Apple iPad.
